content.content: 960×540 59.7 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the State of Dai. Now separate from the Weekly Relay with the objective to scale and improve all the information you need for your Dai escapades!  Peg869×620 89.4 KB   Some high volume trades at the beginning and end of the week led to some turbulence, but overall the peg is tightening by the week.    A 7-day high of 1.047 and a low of .944 - averaging to 1.000061.   Dai Supply1348×735 57 KB   The total supply took a nice leap to 9.67 billion, with the TVL in the protocol situated just under 17 billion.   Mint/burn1871×296 29.6 KB   A positive net mint/burn of 312,319,106 Dai.   Vaults608×534 21.6 KB   We had a total of 44 vaults opened by 29 unique creators.   Collateral list 1847×894 73.8 KB   Collateral list 2845×675 46.3 KB  MakerBurn rundown  PSM USDC 3.85 billion  ETH-A 2.61 billion WBTC-A 1.1 billion ETH-C 564.63 million PSM USDP 499.97 million ETH-B 89.95 million LINK 74.39 million GUNI DAI-USDC (0.05%) 73 million Aave D3M 64.96 million UniV2DaiUSDC 61.94 million stEth 57.85 million YFI 27.92 million MATIC-A 19.87 million UniV2UsdcEth 18.34 million NSDROP 10.56 Million WBTC-C 10.13 million GUNI DAI-USDC (0.01%) 10 million GUSD 4.98 million UniV2WBTCEth 4.84 million renBTC 4.75 million MANA 3.76 million UNI 3.17 million FFT1-DROP 2.15 million WBTC-B 1.95 million HTC-DROP 1.64 million 6s Capital 1.43 million UniV2wBTC-Dai 1.06 million   Other vaults below 500K (UniV2DaiEth, UniV2UniEth, CF-DROP) at 483k.    Dai trapped in blacklisted wallets on Ethereum.   Loan-to-Value1256×287 19.9 KB   The current LTV of 99% matches a 3-month high and looks to be climbing.  LTV allows lenders to assess the risk of a secured loan by taking the loan amount and setting it relative to the asset’s current market value. (LTV = (Amount owed on a loan/Appraised value of asset) x 100).     wstETH performance over time1595×538 137 KB   Total wstETH vaults have been steadily growing since launch.   Liquidation walls774×486 80.1 KB   The liquidation walls are looking slightly forgiving this week, beginning around an 8% market drop before sharpening significantly at around 15%. If we do see another week of red, the UniV2 USDC-ETH vaults will assume the greatest risk of liquidation.   7-day Liquidations921×497 15.1 KB   That said, we only had one liquidation last week, affecting an ETH-A vault.  daistats.com | makerburn.com | maker.blockanalitica.com  Disclaimer This update is assembled by a group of contributing members in the MakerDAO community. This does not serve as financial advice or an inducement to vote in any specific way. This update is purely for information and communication purposes only.
The video version is now available on the MakerDAO Youtube channel:

2052×553 83.3 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the State of Dai. Now separate from the Weekly Relay with the objective to scale and improve all the information you need for your Dai escapades!  The public PDF version is available here.   Peg874×627 124 KB   Quiet week in the markets leads to a quiet week on the peg.    Max and min at 1.05 and .88. Uniswap v2 pools were leading the lows.    You can see flappy Friday reflected on the Uni v2 pools dailies and a return to peg stability more recently. There is only 60 million in Liquidity in these pools, worth mentioning since the UNIv2-LP deposits in vaults are the same amount. It seems like the appetite for leverage on v2 types isn’t as pronounced.   Messari volume968×496 39.8 KB   2.39 billion in volume this last week, according to Messari.   DAI Supply1359×741 72.2 KB   Supply at 9.5 billion with a slightly higher average collateralization ratio of 167%.    Net burn of 56 million this last week.    192 vaults were created over the week.   Collateral 24 change905×416 80.1 KB   Trying something new and including the 24-hour changes in supply. GUNI is capped.   Collateral list 1881×885 164 KB   Collateral list 2878×674 104 KB  MakerBurn rundown  PSM USDC 4.6 billion  ETH-A 1.9 billion WBTC-A 953 million PSM USDP 495 million ETH-C 272 million GUNI DAI-USDC (0.01%) 208 million LINK 77 million GUNI DAI-USDC (0.05%) 69 million stEth 64 million UniV2DaiUSDC 60 million Aave D3M 50 million ETH-B 48 million MATIC-A 19 million YFI 15 million NSDROP 12 Million UniV2UsdcEth 11.5 million PSM GUSD 9.9 million WBTC-C 9.8 million MANA 4.7 million renBTC 3.7 million WBTC-B 2.5 million FFT1-DROP 2.1 million HTC-DROP 2.09 million UNI 1.7 million 6S Capital 1.4 million   Other vaults below 500K (UniV2WBTCEth, UniV2DaiEth, UniV2UniEth) at $1.8 million.   Loan-to-Value1449×315 38.8 KB   Maker’s Loan-to-value peaked at 103% last Monday. Now back to 97%.   23% drop1089×455 64.3 KB   A 23% drop is where the liquidations start to get steep.   23% scenario926×885 186 KB   In that hypothetical drop, WBTC is at the highest risk, but that’s the celsius vault. ETH vaults are the second set at risk, and at the bottom of the list are the largest LINK vaults. Thanks to blockanalytica, we can see that most of these are low risk and have been actively managed historically.    In aggregate, most of the debt is in low-risk buckets—medium risk at 495 million and high risk at 97 million.  daistats.com | makerburn.com | maker.blockanalitica.com   Have Feedback? We value your input! Take our survey to let us know what we might be missing or how to do better. Disclaimer: This update is assembled by a group of contributing members in the MakerDAO community. This does not serve as financial advice or an inducement to vote in any specific way. This update is purely for information and communication purposes only.

1990×947 110 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the State of Dai. Now separate from the Weekly Relay with the objective to scale and improve all the information you need for your Dai escapades!  PDF version available here for download.   Peg869×614 152 KB   As expected, the drawdowns in both crypto and equities pushed the market all over the place.    The peg spread hit a maximum and minimum of 1.11 and .84, respectively.     Largest824×433 18 KB   Some massive trades (70MM according to decipher) stand out. Unsure about the reliability of that data. However, it does correlate with the volume spike.   Messari volume1396×330 24.8 KB   Messari reported a single-day spike of 1.1 billion on Flappy Friday.   1095×543 36.6 KB   Shown above are Uniswap candles for the DAI/USDC pair, which are the largest by volume; Same story throughout the week.   Nomics data midpoint1145×631 80.4 KB   The midpoint on that pair was still under par with a 0.01 spread and 52 million DAI depth.   Curve at 48 million1082×495 76.3 KB   In the past 24 hours, Curve has dominated with 48 million in volume.   DAI Supply1367×741 74.1 KB   Despite all this, DAI supply is still up above 9.7 billion, with 15 billion locked. PSMs saw heavy usage this weekend, and USDC has spiked back to 51.4% of Dai (at time of writing).    Last week contained a net Dai burn of 182 million.    64 vaults have been created.   Collateral list 1871×883 163 KB   Collateral list 2886×675 108 KB  MakerBurn rundown  PSM USDC 4.5 billion (ATH)  ETH-A 2.06 billion WBTC-A 1.00 billion PSM USDP 500 million ETH-C 325 million Aave D3M 83 million LINK 71 million GUNI DAI-USDC (0.05%) 70 million UniV2DaiUSDC 61 million stEth 41 million ETH-B 39 million YFI 24 million MATIC-A 19 million UniV2UsdcEth 13 million NSDROP 10 Million GUNI DAI-USDC (0.01%) 10 million WBTC-C 9.7 million GUSD 4.6 million renBTC 3.8 million MANA 3.7 million UniV2WBTCEth 2.9 million WBTC-B 2.4 million FFT1-DROP 2.2 million HTC-DROP 2.1 million UNI 1.7 million 6S Capital 1.4 million   Other vaults below 500K (wBTC-B, UniV2DaiEth, UniV2UniEth, CF-DROP) at $822,890.   Loan-to-Value1330×314 37.1 KB   LTV has exceeded 100%, clocking in at 123%.   20% drop1041×430 62 KB   Hypothetically, as if we could stomach more, a 20% drop in the market would coincide with the next liquidation wave.   WBTC exposure is still high527×604 37.4 KB   Refer to Primoz’s excellent analysis of the weekend to see where slippage was most apparent. WBTC had 7.28% slippage. Maker has 47.6% of assets, which is good to keep in mind for the next set of signal requests.    Even on 280 million, there is significant slippage for WBTC.   WBTC drop1075×427 64.3 KB   Luckily, the vaults on WBTC-A & WBTC-C are well protected. They would need a 10k drop, more than 30%, for any significant threats.  daistats.com | makerburn.com | maker.blockanalitica.com   Have Feedback? We value your input! Take our survey to let us know what we might be missing or how to do better. Disclaimer: This update is assembled by a group of contributing members in the MakerDAO community. 960×540 164 KB  Hi everyone, thanks for checking out the State of Dai. Now separate from the Weekly Relay with the objective to scale and improve all the information you need for your Dai escapades!  Peg863×608 120 KB   We saw heavy turbulence in the market and thus turbulence in the peg—multiple high-capital trades above and below the peg in a confusing market.    This looks like Dai pricing 7-day max of 1.122 and a min of .951 - averaging out to 1.000027. Silver lining overall, the peg saw some variance but was affected very little if one zooms out.   Dai Supply1349×736 56.8 KB   The total supply dipped just below 9.3 billion, and TVL in the protocol dropped to 15.7 billion.    Net burn of 78 million Dai.   Vaults609×531 20.8 KB   A total of 83 new vaults were opened by 45 unique creators.   Dai on DEXs889×441 34.5 KB   The 7th was a high-volume kind of day, with both 1inch and Uniswap topping 110 million Dai traded in a 24-hr window.   794×608 63.1 KB   Maker has a 50% share of the ETH locked into lending protocols.   Collateral list 1845×891 71.3 KB   Collateral list 2841×675 47.6 KB  MakerBurn rundown  PSM USDC 3.52 billion  ETH-A 2.64 billion WBTC-A 1.10 billion ETH-C 552.70 million PSM USDP 499.97 million ETH-B 87.02 million GUNI DAI-USDC (0.05%) 77.88 million LINK 74.13 million stEth 49 million UniV2DaiUSDC 43.22 million YFI 21.91 million MATIC-A 19.75 million UniV2UsdcEth 15.83 million NSDROP 10.69 Million WBTC-C 10.14 million GUNI DAI-USDC (0.01%) 10 million MANA 6.30 million GUSD 4.98 million renBTC 4.73 million UniV2WBTCEth 4.54 million UNI 3.23 million WBTC-B 2.49 million FFT1-DROP 2.15 million HTC-DROP 1.46 million 6s Capital 1.43 million UniV2wBTC-Dai 1.11 million   Other vaults below 500K (UniV2DaiEth, UniV2UniEth, CF-DROP) at 583k.   Loan-to-Value1245×299 19.7 KB   The current LTV of 99% is even with the previous high seen in October. With a 1% uptick to 100%, the total would be the highest since the DeFi run in the summer of 2021.  LTV allows lenders to assess the risk of a secured loan by taking the loan amount and setting it relative to the asset’s current market value. (LTV = (Amount owed on a loan/Appraised value of asset) x 100).     wstETH performance over time782×599 70.8 KB   After a fast and furious launch, the wstETH vault has cooled down to an average collateralization ratio of 299%.   Liquidation walls739×491 81.6 KB   Liquidation walls are unforgiving, beginning at a 7% market drop before sharpening significantly.   17 percent drop model938×830 183 KB   In that hypothetical drop, vaults riding the edge of collateralization are on WBTC and ETH.   Loans per project771×520 57.4 KB   wBTC deposits have continued to trend up since October, including regular MATIC deposits.   auctions913×397 15.1 KB   63 auctions in the last week on the following vault types**:  ETH-A, ETH-B, and ETH-C stETH wBTC-A and B renBTC MATIC   Average settling time was around 35 mins.    Growth across different vaults ilks had a healthy bump in WBTC this past week.  daistats.com | makerburn.com | maker.blockanalitica.com  Disclaimer This update is assembled by a group of contributing members in the MakerDAO community.
